Event.0: American actor Charlton Heston, who possessed a commanding screen presence and was best known for such films as The Ten Commandments (1956) and Planet of the Apes (1968), died in California.
Event.1: Mori Yoshiro of the Liberal-Democratic Party became prime minister of Japan, replacing Obuchi Keizo, who had suffered a stroke earlier in the month and subsequently died.
Event.2: American grunge rocker Kurt Cobain, leader of the band Nirvana, committed suicide.
Event.3: Fox TV network premieres showing "Married With Children" and "The Tracey Ullman Show"
Event.4: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar breaks Wilt Chamberlain's all-time career scoring record of 31,419 points (31,421)
Event.5: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar surpassed Wilt Chamberlain as the all-time leading scorer in the National Basketball Association.
Event.6:
Pharrell Williams
American musician and producer
was born
Event.7: Musician Ray Charles (24) weds Della Beatrice Howard
Event.8: Julius Rosenberg and Ethel Rosenberg were sentenced to death for espionage; two years later they became the first American civilians executed for that crime.
Event.9:
Gregory Peck
American actor
was born
Event.10: American actress Bette Davis—whose raw unbridled intensity kept her at the top of her profession for 50 years—was born.
Event.11:
Bette Davis
American actress
was born
Event.12: Chile declares war on Bolivia and Peru, starting the War of the Pacific.
Event.13: Johann Strauss Jr's opera "Die Fledermaus" premieres in Vienna
Event.14: Birkenhead Park, the first civic public park, opens in Birkenhead, England, designed by Joseph Paxton
Event.15: American educator and reformer Booker T. Washington was born in Virginia.
Event.16:
Robert Smalls
American politician
was born
Event.17: In the Battle of Maipú, Chile's independence movement - led by Bernardo O'Higgins and José de San Martín - win a decisive victory over Spain, leaving 2,000 Spaniards and 1,000 Chilean patriots dead.
Event.18:
Battle of Maipú
Chile's independence movement, led by José de San Martín and Bernardo O'Higgins, won a decisive victory over Spain in the Battle of Maipú, which left 2,000 Spaniards and 1,000 Chilean patriots dead on this day in 1818.
Event.19: Dutch navigator Jacob Roggeveen discovers Easter Island
Event.20: Dutch painter Jan Vermeer marries Catharina Bolenes in Schipluiden
Event.21: The Mayflower departed for England after having deposited 102 Pilgrims at what became the American colony of Plymouth (Massachusetts).
Event.22: Powhatan Indian Pocahontas married Virginia planter and colonial official John Rolfe.
Event.23: American Indian princess Pocahontas and daughter of chief Powhatan marries English colonist John Rolfe
Event.24:
Thomas Hobbes
English philosopher
was born
Event.25: English philosopher and political theorist Thomas Hobbes, best known for his publications on individual security and the social contract, was born.
Event.26: Alexander Nevsky of Novgorod defeats Teutonic Knights in the Battle of the Ice
